trans-unit.source: Provides information about a running application.
The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationInfo> object is used by the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationManager> class for information about running applications.
Gets the unique identifier for the application.
For applications running under Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS), the application ID is the metabase path to the application root, such as /LM/W3SVC/1/Root/application.

The unique identifier for the application specified when the application was created by using the <xref href="System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationManager.CreateObject(System.String,System.Type,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)"></xref> method.
Gets the physical path corresponding to the application's root.

The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationInfo.PhysicalPath%2A> property is the path that was passed to the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationManager.CreateObject%2A> method when the application was created.
The physical path corresponding to the application's root.
Gets the virtual path corresponding to the application's root.

The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationInfo.VirtualPath%2A> property is the virtual path that was passed to the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationManager.CreateObject%2A> method when the application was created.
The virtual path corresponding to the application's root.
